lines.content: Add different types of tasks to a list.
List all the existing tasks, with their completion status.
Remove a task from the list.
Sets a task's completion status to completed.
Use a keyword to find tasks that include the keyword in their task description.
### `todo` - add a Todo task to the list
Adds a task of type 'Todo' to the task list.
### `event` - add an Event task to the list
Adds a task of type 'Event' to the task list. Use /at to specify event date or time.
### `deadline` - add a Deadline task to the list
Adds a task of type 'Deadline' to the task list. Use /by to specify the deadline.
Input deadline in format YYYY-MM-DD for Dook to recognise and print the date in MMM DD YYYY style.
Shows a numbered list of all existing tasks, with their descriptions and completion statuses.
Dook will list your tasks now:
Set a task's completion status to done.
Dun dun dun dun! This task is done:
### `delete` - remove a task from the list
Removes an existing task from the task list.
This task has been whisked out of existence:
Finds and shows tasks which contain the matching keyword.
Dook has found the following tasks:
Exits Dook. All existing tasks are saved in a .txt file and restored upon startup.
Goodbye, see you in the seventh dimension!
tasks = storage.loadTasks(); // Get tasks from txt file
Command c = Parser.parse(userInput, tasks); // Prepare the Command object

* @param userInput Input obtained from the user.
* @param tasks TaskList object containing all the tasks added to the list.
* @return an object that is a child class of Command.
public static Command parse (String userInput, TaskList tasks) {
case "done": // Mark a task as done

* If the file is empty or does not exist, returns an empty TaskList.
return new TaskList(); // Returns empty task list
while (scanner.hasNext()) { // Read the file line by line

* Represents the command entered by the user.

* Represents the command to delete a task from the list.
* Removes the task from the task list based on the index given.
* Represents the command to mark a task as done.
* Sets a task's completion status to true.
* Represents the command to exit the program.
* Sets the exit status of the program to true, so that it terminates on the next iteration.
* Represents the command to list all existing tasks.
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
* Thrown when input command is invalid.
* Thrown when a task is missing parts of the input description.
* Represents a task of the type Deadline.
* A Deadline object contains the required date of completion in addition to information contained in its parent class, Task.
return String.format("%s,%d,%s,%s\n", taskType, doneValue, description.strip(), by);
date = LocalDate.parse(by); // Parse input of form yyyy-mm-dd
return "[D]" + super.toString() + " (by: " + by + ")"; // If not in correct date format, print original String
* Represents a task of the type Event.
* An Event object contains the time frame of the event in addition to information contained in its parent, Task.
return String.format("%s,%d,%s,%s\n", this.taskType, doneValue, this.description.strip(), this.at);
* Represents a task specified by the user.
* A Task object contains its task description, completion status, and letter code for its task type.
* Returns tick if task has been marked as completed, or X otherwise.
* @return Tick symbol if completed, cross symbol otherwise.
* Returns String in the format used for recording tasks in the .txt file.
* Returns re-formatted task description for displaying of task details.
* Represents the main task list, with operations to list, add and delete tasks.
* Prints all tasks in the task list.
System.out.println("\t Dook will list your tasks now:");
* Appends new task to the list.
* Finds tasks with matching descriptions and lists them.
System.out.println("\t Dook has found the following tasks: ");
* Sets a task's completion status to true and prints done message.
* @param description String index of the task to be marked as done, based on its list position.
int taskIdx = Integer.parseInt(description) - 1; // -1 for zero-based indexing
System.out.println("\t Dun dun dun dun! This task is done:");
System.out.println("\t Dook does not recognise this task!");
* Deletes a task from the task list.
* @param description String index of the task to be deleted, based on its list position.
System.out.println("\t This task has been whisked out of existence:");
System.out.println("\t Dook does not recognise this task!");
* Represents a task of the type Todo.
System.out.println("\t Does the human have a request today?");
System.out.println("\t Goodbye, see you in the seventh dimension!");

* Prints the message shown when there is an IO exception.
